Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a separate bowl, mix the sour cream, green chilies, and salt. Place half of the cooked rice at the bottom of a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Spread the sour cream mixture over the rice, then evenly sprinkle the Monterey Jack cheese on top. Add half of the olives, followed by the rest of the cooked rice and Cheddar cheese. Top the casserole with the remaining olives for decoration.

Charge the rice in a saucepan with water, then bring it to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 to 25 minutes.
